intro: Hieracium karmoyense, commonly known as Karmøy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Norway. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has a low-growing habit with bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native habitat.
